identificationModule.briefTitle: Clinical Study of CD276 Targeted Autologous Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cell Infusion in Patients With CD276 Positive Advanced Solid Tumor
identificationModule.officialTitle: Clinical Study of CD276 Targeted Autologous Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cell Infusion in Patients With CD276 Positive Advanced Solid Tumor

collaborators.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Cd276 (B7-H3) is an ideal target for car-t treatment because of its high expression on the surface of neuroblastoma, osteosarcoma, gastric cancer and lung cancer cells, but not in normal peripheral cells or tissues. In conclusion, car-t cell therapy has achieved exciting results in blood tumors, but it has been stopped in solid tumor. The main reason for the poor effect is the existence of tumor microenvironment of solid tumor, which inhibits the chemotaxis and infiltration of car-t cells to tumor site. Therefore, in this clinical experiment, we will explore the best model of car-t therapy for solid tumor by intravenous and local tumor injection, which will bring new hope to patients with osteosarcoma, neuroblastoma and gastric cancer

armGroups.label: T cell injection targeting CD276 chimeric antigen receptor
interventionNames: Drug: Targeting CD276 CAR T cells

interventions.name: Targeting CD276 CAR T cells
interventions.description: Targeting CD276 autologous chimeric antigen receptor T cells
armGroupLabels: T cell injection targeting CD276 chimeric antigen receptor

primaryOutcomes.description: The highest concentration of CAR-T cells in peripheral blood after infusion
